page.title: 06FACTORY CLOSES AT OSBOURNBY.
page.content: In 1981 an excavator manufacturer moved his factory from Osbournby.It employed 50;10 from the village and 2 others from within the block.Only 3 have remained with the firm since its move.The absence of the factory as a source of work may lead to further loss of population.The daily influx of people to work in the factory brought trade to the pub,the garage and the village shops.As most village people now work outside the village and tend to shop in the towns the loss of custom might put the survival of post office andshops at risk.The garage and pub,which stand on the A15 road,are more likely to be able to survive.
